description:
Came for a quick lunch and tried out their bento box. Great deal! It comes with rice, entree, soup, and came with both sashimi and sushi! By far the salmon sashimi pieces were the best part of the meal. I would return to get more sushi/sashimi. 

The only thing was the service was a little slow, so maybe not the best place if you're on a tight schedule.  But I did see a couple of people picking up to-go orders of the bento boxes, so there's ways to get around the wait.
author: Cindy H.

description:
Five stars! We walked in and found a relaxing vibe in the center of it all in San Francisco. The staff was extremely friendly and polite, we sat at the bar and we enjoyed some Asahi on draft during happy hour which was goin on until 7pm and we ordered chicken katsu and salmon teriyaki, we did not get down with their raw selections but I will be back and definitely give their sashimi a shot. 

I left very pleased and surprised that this little place existed in the middle of downtown. It has a great vibe, feels like your neighborhood sushi joint and it is very relaxing inside.
author: Karlos G.

description:
Nice little place.
Conveniently located behind the LA fitness so you can have a nice time with friends after a good workout or just lunch with coworkers.
The sushi is good and the service very cordial.
author: Carmen S.

description: Really friendly service, but fish wasn't very fresh and about 25%-33% more expensive than normal sushi restaurants. Premium location may explain the higher cost. I tried the poke bowl and for $14 it was so so. Just lettuce, a little mushroom and tuna with sauce, so price was steep compared to a poke bowl place. The Beach Crunch Roll was kind of a weird texture combo of raw and crunchy.
author: Tu-Quyen P.

description:
3.5/5- Rounding up for great service
Ok there's definitely better sushi spots in the city but Kaisen gives the same quality as your run-of-the-mil place but with a better price point and service so I decided to round up. Our server was so nice and attentive. Restroom is in the hotel next door.

Between my friend and I we got the:
1) Beach Crunch Roll: Fairly standard roll w/ escolar, salmon, cilantro, jalapeno. The "crunch" part was the tempura bits which I didn't find all that necessary. The ingredients semi worked together though it really needed a sauce or something else to tie it together. There was a cool sriracha dragon on the side that looked gorgeous though didn't go all that well w/ the roll for me.

2) 7 Piece Nigiri combo w/ hamachi roll: For $23 I'm pretty happy. Portions were generous and the fish was thick but not so much where it felt like I was just biting a straight fish off the line. There was also a decent variety that isn't just salmon & tuna. Garnishes were simple ranging from green onion to yuzu kosho to ginger. Fish all had some flavor and rice was average. Slightly seasoned and texture was it was a bit on the tougher side but still stuck together without being too compact. For my 7 pieces I believe I got yellowfin, suzuki (or tai?), salmon, seared escolar, albacore, hamachi toro?, & seared mackerel?

Overall, while I can't say this is great sushi spot that I would go out of my way for. It's convenient, cheap, has variety, and wonderful service. If I'm ever working nearby I'd consider coming back again.
author: Vivian C.

description:
Super fast fresh delicious sushi and a really friendly staff. I just needed a quick bite before a meeting and this was exactly that. It was really close to my hotel, which is how I found it on Yelp, of course. 

As basic as I was feeling, I got the California Roll with eel sauce. Keep it simple people! It was so yummy and just what I was looking for. My service was über friendly and if I am ever in the area again, I will certainly be back!
author: Max R.

description:
Uhhh, yum! 

My boyfriend and I realized we wanted sushi for dinner after doing some shopping at Westfield, so we took to Yelp. The closest was Kaisen Sushi, so we decided to give them a try! 

From the outside they don't look like anything special, but we stepped inside and they had almost every table packed... So we figured they had to be good! 

One of the first things I noticed was that for checking in on Yelp, you get a free sake shot or matcha ice cream... We checked in, and my boyfriend got a free (hot) sake shot. Yum! 

We sat at the sushi bar and the waitress was really busy running around tending to other tables and running between the kitchen and the dining area. I've been to several sushi joints where you can order at the bar, so I asked the chef if that was possible, and he pointed to the waitress and s said, "Uhh, just a minute."

We ended up waiting like ten more minutes until our order was finally taken... I could tell she was definitely busy, I just wish there had been better communication or more staff in general so we weren't left feeling confused and forgotten.

We ordered quite the spread - miso soup, gyoza, two Crunchy Spicy California Rolls, a Caterpillar Roll, and a Volcano Roll. 

The miso soup was really yummy. Just the right amount of salt and the tofu chunks weren't too big. I really liked it! Our gyoza were tasty too - crunchy and full of flavor. They were on HH as well, which is always a bonus. $5 for a plate of 6.

The sushi was delicious and presented SO BEAUTIFULLY. We each got our orders on wooden platters with different art in the middle of it. I got a peacock and my boyfriend got an octopus. It was so cute! 

The Caterpillar Roll was a shrimp tempura roll and it was good. There was something sweet in it that wasn't my favorite but it didn't ruin it for me.

The Spicy Crunchy California Roll is NOOO JOKEEE. It was so good, but god DAMN it was spicy. This isn't just me saying that because I'm white, either. This thing was packing REAL HEAT. I've had so many "spicy" california rolls that can't even come close to touching this roll. It was sooo good, but it'll get your nose running for sure.

I'm in this area of SF for work once or twice a year, so I'm definitely looking forward to coming back when I'm notttt pregnant and can explore more of the menu.
author: Lauren P.

description:
Ended up here randomly after wanting some sushi while in the area. I definitely would not have found this place if it weren't for Yelp.

Location: It's on 5th Street, so it's a bit sketchy around the area, but convenient if you're out at the mall or something.

Ambiance: Super casual, no frills.

Service: Pretty good, but nothing extra special.

Food: We ordered a couple of their rolls, including my go-to Rainbow Roll. Their sushi rolls were pretty good. They even serve it with a design made with the sauces so it's pretty.

Would I return? Maybe if I was looking for some quick an easy sushi and was in the area. Usually I'm really picky about where I get raw fish, but this fit the bill that day!
author: Leana L.

description:
Solid restaurant for sushi rolls, but nothing to write home about. The rolls are like anything you can get elsewhere.. filling but neither bad nor good. I really liked the Karaage, there was a nice peppery heat to them that made them really tasty. The seafood salad was a solid side, with little bits of diced sashimi and avocado over a bed of lettuce. 

Nigiri was good, but a tad bit on the expensive side. I would hesitate to recommend ordering sushi a la carte here. The sushi set dinners seem like the better option if your heart is set on nigiri.

Price-wise it's not too bad. Service was great and food came out pretty fast on a quiet Sunday evening. One odd thing.. the restrooms are located in the Pickwick hotel next door. The server can tell you the combination to get inside.
author: Tien L.

description:
I ordered a Meal Pal meal here which included a tonkatsu, bbq roll and rice and salad. And while it's awesome when businesses have their food ready, it's just plain bad when the food comes out cold, as if it had been sitting around for hours.

By that point the ride was cold, the tonkatsu had lost most of its crispy texture, the salad had soaked up too much dressing and was soggy. It was just an overall unpleasant experience, and here's to hoping they improve the food quality a bit at least in freshness for their MealPals.
author: Tyler T.

description:
I was craving sushi really badly and went on Yelp looking for a spot and this is what came up with moderate prices. 

I love this place, but I hate that they're closed from 4-6 everyday in the Financial District. I get off work at 5 and had to wait until 6 until they were open. Luckily, they're on the side of Westfield Mall. The joint is small, a couple of tables, a sushi bar. They have happy hour with a small selection of cheap bites and drinks.

I ordered to-go. Dragon Roll, Caterpillar Roll and Tobiko Nigiri. I waited 10 minutes for my food. The server who took me order poured me a warm cup of tea while I waited at the bar. 

After I got home, I dug in and everything was amazing. The Dragon Roll had a perfect mix of unagi and avocado and sauce. The caterpillar tasted as it should. Everything was fresh and rolled perfectly. 

This is my new go to sushi spot in San Francisco.
author: Judy H.

description: Normally This is my go to place , I was the first customer of the day when the doors opened this morning , they were attentive and nice . I asked how long it would be for a LionKing my sushi favorite and I have had at this spot more than once. Maybe I should have stopped at one piece but I am sure the rice was old. The taste and texture was not right . I am praying not to get sick because I know I should have put it down. Fat girl chronicles and Server , I try not to return foodMaybe I should waited til later when that old rice would be been gone , lesson learned never be the first bird to the worm, kind of saddened that all I can think about is Yoshusi
author: Sarita R.

description:
OMG, I chose this place because I wanted to eat a little lighter that I have  been at our work week..and so based on reviews...decided to give it a try!  I am so glad I did.  

Came in with a few coworkers and we all ordered something different!  I also wanted to see this "sushi art" everyone was talking about and the sushi chef didn't disappoint!  The sushi was fresh and I loved it!

Definitely a place I am bookmarking so I can come back.  I live in the East Bay so not in my normal range of places I go, but I will drive over for this!
author: Ava E.

description:
I got pulled in by their happy hour specials! And they didn't disappoint! I thought for sure the happy hour dishes would be minuscule since they usually are at Japanese happy hours so I was very pleased to see that they were a good size. We got the seaweed salad, gyoza, and takoyaki from their happy hour menu. 

We also ordered their dragon roll and one of their rolls featuring eel. Both were delicious. And look at the plating of the dragon roll! I appreciate those details. 

I would definitely go back again. Great place to go after shopping at the mall.
author: Emma W.

description: I went here for a team lunch, and it's really great! They have a lunch special for 12.95 which is an appetizer, main, and sushi roll with miso soup, salad, and rice. I got sweet potato fries, chicken teriyaki, and a eel avocado roll. It was all very tasty and quite a lot of food. Plus the bento box they serve it in is quite cute.
author: Elaine L.

description:
Came in off the street after a day of shopping and spa.  Service was fantastic and attentive. The food came out really quick and taste incredibly fresh! I'm so happy I ran into this place and will be coming again!

The koi fish drawing with the sauces was classic!!
author: Max G.

description:
I eat here all the time, especially the happy hour. Frankly it's the best sushi place dollar for dollar in San Francisco IMO. Good fish, very fresh.

WITH THAT SAID, they are sometimes inconsistent, and I actually like their Teriyaki Chicken the least of all the places I go. You guys gotta cook it more, get a little blackened on that chicken!

Happy hour is undeniably the best sushi deal in town and with $3 beers, you ain't got nothing to complain about.

If you want the best, I still like Ryoko, but eating sushi and having drinks for less than 50 bucks for two? Yeah, ain't nothing else in town comin close.
author: John W.

description:
Decor: walk in clinic 
Service: great
Food: stellar ish

Hi San Francisco. Thanx for the teriyaki and memories. 

This is a non descript, walk in off the street, no frills sushi place. This is your brain on SoMo district sushi: Clean, efficiently staffed, good portion size, fresh fish. Any questions?
author: Hadiza A.

description:
Pretty standard sushi place, with very nice servers.

I will caveat that I'm not big into sushi and raw fish, but I did like their veggie roll. The lion king roll was also pretty good, but a tad sweet for me.

Their fried calamari has good flavor but is chewy, so not ideal texture wise.

I want to try their non sushi options next time because I saw they have chicken katsu.
author: Elena K.

description:
This is the closest, reasonably affordable, sushi place next to our new apartment so we decided to try it out the other night. They do happy hour 6-7:30 so that's a plus! We were quickly sat around 6ish and sat at the sushi bar. The place is pretty small and I have walked by and seen the place full so it was nice to get in right away. We got a few things off the happy hour menu: seaweed salad, veggie gyoza and takoyaki balls. Seaweed salad was the typical, always delicious seaweed salad you get everywhere. Gyoza was nice a crunchy but the takoyaki balls were, dare I say, kind of gross. They weren't crispy like you'd expect from a fried item. They came out looking pretty but they were rubbery all throughout, octopus especially! So that was a bummer.

Other than that, everything else was good. We shared two rolls, I love rolls so I'd be back for them but not the takoyaki balls. We got the golden gate roll and the beach crunch. Bot where very nicely plated and delicious. Service was great too!
author: Katlyn H.

description: Nice sushi spot located by a hotel. They have bar and table seating. It wasn't busy when I went so I just sat at a table even though I was by myself. Water was always filled which is always good and wait service was fast. They had 2 TVs with sports playing and also background music which sounded like top 40 playlist. I really loved the baked scallop roll I ordered. While it's really not traditional sushi roll, I liked how the melted mozzarella went well with the scallops on this roll.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
They are very very nice here, and they have some pretty good options in terms of the size of the menu. It's slightly more expensive than south bay sushi but... obviously lol

They were quite artistic, and drew in all their numerous sauces a peacock and another fancy design on the plates for our rolls.

I didn't think *all* the flavors made sense - my roll for example had cilantro in it, and was pretty loosely rolled so it was kind of difficult to eat.

We were able to pop in and out before an event so that's all we wanted! Thanks for the attentive service :)
author: Rachel W.

description:
I'm writing this from the lens of a low-key, reasonably priced small place that does basic sushi and a small step above vs. gourmet, fancy stuff.

They have a stellar happy hour; $5 rolls and appetizers and they aren't chintzy.  I had 2 nicely stuffed hand rolls with salmon or tuna and avocado, cucumber, and some nice spicy sauce.  I also had seaweed salad which was quite sizable.  Literally you could make a nice meal out of happy hour stuff - both times I was there between 5:00-7:00.

The other, non-happy hour stuff is basic nigiri as you'd expect and some commonly known rolls.  All quite well done and very affordable.  They have various beer and sake options as well and plum wine and non-alcoholic drinks

Small place; sushi bar seats about 10 - then a handful of tables
author: Dave C.

description: This place has one of the best happy hours. The time goes to 7:30 pm so basically most of normal dinner time. The hand wraps were delicious and there amount of tako yaki is quite generous. This is my go to spot if I'm doing late night shopping or seeing a movie since its about the cheapest place around if you only order from their happy hour menu. The quality is decent and I never had to wait.
author: Diane Z.

description:
My husband loved his sushi and the California hand roll I got was fine ( after telling them I ordered a hand roll not a normal roll) they came back with it. Then I ordered the bento box with teriyaki chicken. They gave me salmon , which I do not like. They took it back then returned it with warm salad warm roll cold rice and chicken , with salmon pieces underneath. They just removed the salmon and put chicken on top. 

Pregnant- everyone in my party finished eating and I still hadn't gotten my box. When I realized there was still pieces of salmon left over we told them and he just nodded like yeah I just took it off and replaced chicken. 

So they took off the bento box. So starving everyone is done and I'm leaving hungry
author: Borba F.

description: Wonderful sushi place by my house!  I wish I had discovered this place earlier!  The plating is gorgeous, and the fish is all super fresh.  They have a great selection of rolls too.  Good happy hour 7 days a week, but only hand rolls.
author: Rebecca W.

description: Got here when it opened on a Friday night. Attentive and pleasant servers. Very focused sushi chefs making yummy, fresh sushi. Seafood salad was delish! Toro was tender, tasty. Place got busy fast. Liked the poppy 50'/60's music. Close to theater and all sorts of fun stuff (ice cream museum, Powell Street...). I'd come back!!
author: Sage D.

description: Yummy! The food here was really good and fresh. Best Salmon Katsu I've ever had! The sushi and gyoza were also lip smacking. The waiter was very fun and kind. Would highly recommend this place. Th artwork on the food was beautiful! I didn't want to eat it because of the beauty!
author: Runa M.

description: Just came in today and there was a line of people waiting to get in when they opened today at 6:00 pm.
author: Mike D.

description: Best sushi I've tasted so far ! Been wanting to try for months and definitely did not disappoint! Customer service was great and presentation was above and beyond! Caterpillar and dragon roll were delicious along with the lion king.
author: Jenny C.

description:
Rewind 5 years ago.

My bf lives in a walking distance from this place, and I was going through a sushi phase. "Why not try a place nearby?" I thought.

I left with a horrible aching stomach and vomiting. I would walk pass by this place with a turned head.

Fast forward to present time....

I literally took a double take, and had to walk back to look at their reopening sign. Their menu had decent prices for the city, and I was desperate to find a chance to make time to get in, they had a change of management, which means they actually want to try to cook good food! The music is pretty cool too, pandoras top dance hits.

I ordered their appetizer $20 sashimi
It was fresh and decent. There was a green sauce dot on one of the slices, and it was nice. However, I like my sashimi plain, and a choice if I want to add anything. Usually, I don't.

We also tried their dragon roll and crunchy spicy tuna. They were both okay and had a really nice dragon shaped sauce that had a lot of love in it.

Overall, I thought this place was okay. Definitely much better than before the change. However, the food was missing one important ingredient, love.

I know what a dragon roll is made of, I know the ingredients, but I like to have my dishes sprinkled with a big dash of loooooove. So close, but it can definitely be finessed.
author: Lynn C.

description:
I was really excited to try the newly opened Kaisen Sushi as it had some great Yelp reviews and thought it would be a great lunch option. It's clear they are still going through some early growing pains but, overall I was pretty disappointed. 

I grabbed a seat at the bar just after the lunch rush and ordered a bento box. The pricing is fair but, the food was very meh. I watched the sushi bar turn out orders and After about 28 minutes my meal finally arrived. 

My main the roll that came with my meal looked as if they used the last piece of fish in the building. Four of the pieces had a decent size cut but, the other two were very low quality. It kinda grossed me out a bit. The salmon teriyaki was fine but, a portion size for a cat. 

The staff was super apologetic and gave me a 10% discount because everything took so long. Unfortunately $1.25 off my meal wasn't enough to change my mind and think about coming back in the future.
author: Benjamin F.

description:
I am a big time sushi lover. My boyfriend and I found out about this place on Restaurants.com and decided to give it a try. 

Atmosphere: while it is not a fancy place, and the décor seems a little out of place, the overall ambience is fine. We were there during daylight, maybe it has a better vibe during the night time.

Service: our server was named Nu (I think). While he was very friendly, he did make several errors with our experience (he did not bring menus to the table right away, he did not ask if we wanted straws, he hovered around us until we ordered, and when we ordered the Sashimi Deluxe, 36 pieces, we were brought a plate with only 15 pieces), and he seemed to get disoriented when the restaurant got even slightly busy. 

Food: while the food was good, it was not as good as the plate art would suggest. These men are talented with squirt bottles of different colored Mayonnaise for sure! The food was good - but nothing amazing. 

Happy hour: it mostly includes beer and sake, and also includes a spicy tuna hand roll, a rock&roll hand roll, and a California roll hand roll. That's the only sushi on the happy hour. But overall the discounts on the included items are decent.

Price: the sashimi deluxe that we ordered did not come with as many pieces as the photo that was added by the restaurant owners, ours only cake with 15 pieces for the same price, so that is pretty disappointing. We went in with a 25$ gift card, so it made our bill of 65$ only about $45, so I was not quite as frustrated as I may have been given that our order was wrong, but I also can't say that I won't give this place a second chance.
author: Taylor D.

description: I am not a crazy sushi fan, but I definetly crave it sometimes! We came in on their one year anniversary and received a free shot of sake! We were seated immediately at the bar on a friday night, and the service was absolutely amazing! I did not want masago on half the roll I was splitting with a friend, and the chef was able to accomadate to that! We ended up getting Salmon Avo Roll (~$8), 49ers (~$13), and Cherry Blossom Roll. (~$14). My favorite was the 49ers roll and the lemon pieces on top were perfect! The fish was incredibly fresh, fatty, and really food. Overall I could not have asked for better service at a restaurant or better sushi for the price.
author: Manisha P.

description: Ordered three different rolls and got an amazing presentation for all of them. And they were delicious to top it all off. Highly recommend!
author: Eric G.

description: Fresh fish, good service. The Poke Bowl was much bigger than I expected with lots of fresh tuna. The 8 piece rolls were also huge. The place is small and casual. Service was good.
author: Quyen Q.

description: Found on Yelp! Touchdown local spot.  Great sushi - cheap prices.  Fish was fresh, service nice.  Stacks up well relative to Kabota.
author: Pueo K.

description:
Celebrating One year of Service and on 5th at Mission. Independent sushi restaurants are becoming more rare in SF and keeping one going in this local must not be easy.  I would honestly rate Kaisen $ for cost as Sushi grade food stuffs cost $$$$ to keep on hand. 

I had an good meal, on par with any other Sushi meal I have ever eaten. Aside from the more Americanised incantations to come along ( deep fry it ) Sushi is about convention, attention to details and then individual skill.  Chef was on point. Service was vibrant and convicted. 

Wakame salad
Assorted Sashimi 
Uni ( live was sold out )
$27

No room for green tea mochi but i will be back
author: Adam F.

description: Some of the best sushi I've ever had, especially the Kyu roll.  They serve their sushi with some kind of house sauce blend- I have no idea what's in the sauce but it tastes amazing.  This place also has the best presentation I've seen- they once drew an octopus with the sauces.  Not the cheapest, but my favorite place to go when I want to treat my GF to something special.
author: John F.

description:
This place was a last minute choice and it was all thanks to the good ratings on Yelp that we decided to go here. I know Yelp isn't always super accurate, but this time it was! We arrived right when the restaurant was fully book. The actual owner of the restaurant also made timely visits to make sure we were enjoying our food and our stay.  I don't remember exactly what I ordered except for the sashimi combo, and I can confirm all is fresh as it should be!

Meanwhile, it was their two year anniversary, so the owner took shots with us as the store was closing--on the house! 

If you visit this place and want to give them the credit they deserve, be sure to use your social media tools and check in/tweet/gram etc. They'll probably give you a nice freebie!
author: Grady T.

description: New place. Nothing special on menu. Bento box. Typical sashimi like hamachi, salmon, tuna. Some rolls. Uni nigiri. There is no udon though.
author: K P.

description:
Wandered by what looked like a family run sushi bar.  It was fresh and delicious!  I didn't go crazy but sashimi was fresh.  Place was
Packed with locals.  Bento box was a buy for under $15.  Would come here again.  Crazy eclectic music too!
author: Victoria K.

description: Came here on a rainy night and late.  They were opened and served with a smile.  They have 2 TVs with the game playing.  The menu isn't too extensive so choices are easy.  I have the 10 piece sashimi.  Fish was fresh but smaller pieces.  I orders the spicy salmon roll and it was a nice size and delicious.  Came back the next night and it was PACKED not one seat open.  Happy hour was hot!  $4 hand rolls!  Food is excellent!  The only reason it was a four star was it didn't have a huge variety of specialty rolls.
author: Lauren T.

description:
Great lunch spot- reasonably priced menu, good service. Staff was as pleasant and fast. 

Had a bento box with the sashimi- sometimes this is a bad choice, but not here- sashimi was fresh and very good
author: Sarah Louise H.

description: Super friendly and good happy hour specials. Also do some fun things with the rolls on the sauce. Highly recommend!
author: Chris N.

description:
This is where I chose to go for my birthday dinner and it was the best choice ever!! We had my little girl with us, and though the place is tight, they were able to make room for the stroller (I would not recommend bringing a stroller there when it's busy)!

The owner and the staff were so on point and super friendly and personable. When they found out it was my birthday, they even brought me something special!

They also do very cool art on their sushi plates which was a super fun surprise! The prices are really good as well. I would totally recommend this place!
author: Courtney B.

description: Average at best. The salmon teriyaki dinner was disappointing, not to mention it took forever to arrive. The seaweed salad was way too sweet.
author: Kristen S.

description:
Love this place as late night snack, staff is very nice, polite and friendly :)

Love the sauce art , the bird was so cute , I couldn't eat haha (sad)

Sushi was great, recommended the 49er roll, Lion King and baked scallop roll. Miso soup is only 2 dollars .

*the music is mainly electric house and trance* lol I like the music but might not be for everyone .

I will be back (^[ l l ]^)
author: Tiffany F.

description: This place was amazing!!! I mean melt in your mouth amazing... I loved it great service and a nice place.
author: Pausqualina J.

description: Tremendous happy hour will leave both you and your wallet plump and happy! Highly recommend the takoyaki!
author: Tyler W.

description:
Edit to my last review: today's takeout was terrible. No effort into anything. The fish had a weird smell and taste while he chilean teriyaki was cold and rubbery. They forgot the miso soup.... terrible waste of money. 

Would order a roll and dine in if you need to go to Kaizen. They skimp on the quality with takeout and Bento Box
author: Samyutha R.

description: Affordable and delicious! My boyfriend and I shared the bento box for lunch after a long morning of shopping in Union Square. The teriyaki salmon and spicy tuna roll were very flavorful. The service and ambience were decent. Would come back again next time in the city
author: Julie D.

description: We went here for our first meal in San Francisco! We were seated right away, and the restaurant had a nice open-air atmosphere. The sushi was good and not to expensive, and I liked the veggie dumplings a lot too! I would recommend this place for a casual lunch or dinner!
author: Felicia C.

description: Great sushi at a reasonable price. Staff was super friendly, lots of smiles. I ordered two happy hour dishes, a sashimi sampler, and a hand roll - spicy tuna. All were on point, sashimi was especially good!
author: Dustin M.

description:
The service is very friendly and welcoming.  I tried the Cherry Blossom roll, avocado tuna roll, and chicken karaage.       

While the rolls come with beautiful sauce artwork that is unique touch in a sushi joint, I was expecting more in terms of fish quality.  The prices were quite reasonable, so I got over it.  However, the karaage was amazing and perfect.  I highly recommend the karaage.  In fact, I can't wait to try the chicken katsu because I think Kaisen will hit it out of the park.
author: Miran C.

description:
I would highly recommend everyone who looking for good quality and service with affordable price to check this place out!! I've been to this place for a few times and I am totally in love with the food and the service. I passed by and found this place accidentally what a lucky!! 

I had sashimi combo and B&W roll. The fish was very very fresh! Also you would found something unexpected too!! They draw the sushi serving plate with sauce!! THAT WAS SO COOL! It's not only good food but also BEAUTIFUL looking too!! 

Finally I hope everyone got a chance to check this place out and see it if it is same as I say:-) I just feel like I've got to share my very best experience
author: S. P.

description: Wow I ordered sushi for delivery from here and it was the WORST sushi I've ever received. The $25 nigiri combo smelled SO FISHY, it was disgusting. The tuna was legitimately GRAY. Not fresh at all and I can't believe I paid so much for this. The side orders (karage, gyoza) were average. Can't believe they would serve fish that old. Could even eat a bite from the smell.
author: Helen H.

description: Small place, with ~7 tables and some counter seats. Pretty good sushi & quick service. I recommend the deli maki for vegetarians; loved the tempura bits on top. The tonkatsu was pretty decent as well. Given that it is close by, I would come back to this place, though probably not if there was a wait
author: Pallavi K.

description:
Happy hour 6-7:30
Good value with $4 calamari, sweet potato fries, and hand rolls! Other rolls (hamachi and spicy tuna) were good, on the big side with a lot of rice. Rice was well seasoned and perfectly cooked, obviously know what they're doing. 

Great service and perfect location next to the Pickwick Hotel.
author: Rachel S.

description: I love happy hours, you can get a beer under $5 and coz some special roll and my favorite Tako yaki, can u imagine a price below $5 right the heart of SF. I'll be back again.
author: Estada L.

description: Meh, maybe I wasn't feeling it or didn't come at the right time, but I really wanted a baked roll of some sort as I was craving warm food. Came in and got seated at the bar area, I ordered Miso soup, Baked salmon roll, and Takoyaki. The soup was pretty good and the Takoyaki was alright. like some other reviewers mentioned it was kind of rubbery so I will give it an average. I was expecting a baked salmon roll where it is warm, as I took a bite of my salmon roll it was ice cold inside as if it was pre-made and sitting in the fridge and only the very thin outer layer was warm. Even worse, The salmon itself wasn't even completely warm and as I lift up the salmon I see the salmon was grey... I understand its the salmon itself but I didn't expect that to be the whole salmon! In addition, there were flies everywhere! I did not feel like the food I was eating was very clean as theres flies flying everywhere probably on top of sushi ingredients.
author: Nina Y.

description:
Came in for lunch on a Sunday and got a bento box with Salmon Katsu (that was actually good) but the sushi was not great. My spouse and I both had the negihama roll and the fish didn't taste very fresh.

I'd recommend as a quick lunch place with convenient location near the Westfield mall, so you miss a bit of that lunch traffic. Environment was very casual but not loud. My spouse and I were able to chat over lunch easily.
author: Ana S.

description:
I wasn't sure what to expect stopping into here. It's not the most classy place. At first glance, it's small, a little cramped, with EDM playing in the background, and sports+action movies playing on the tv's. Not to mention the blaring LED lights decorating the storefront. But we were seated quickly, had drinks, and ordered food in the perfect amount of time. The food was served much faster than I would've expected. Generally, the quality of service on this beautiful Friday night was much higher than most other bars and restaurants, which were too packed and full of unruly people. Though it initially looked cramped, after we were seated, there was a good sense of intimacy. And, above all, when the food arrived, it tasted amazing! Everything tasted fresh and flavorful. And thanks to the good prices here, the quantity of food was perfect. For around $50 for 2 people, you'll leave full and satisfied (though you can easily pay half that price for 2 people).

Who this location is good for:
- Small groups of 1-6 people
- Anyone looking for delicious sushi at a good price

Who this location isn't good for:
- Large groups
- Anyone looking for a really fancy/classy atmosphere

I can easily say I'll be returning to this location (maybe even today). I expect to become a regular at Kaisen.
author: David S.

description: I took Bento Lunch Box as photo. The beef teriyaki is delicious, tasty and a little sweet. The salmon sashimi is fresh and in good color. I didn't wait for long time to get my lunch. All the staff are kind and friendly. The price of the Bento Lunch box is acceptable in that area. Hope the restaurant runs well.
author: Sherry Y.

description: What a great experience. The food of course was delicious. The employees were all friendly and had great customer service. The restaurant was very clean and really nice. I would definitely recommend this place.
author: Veronica G.

description:
I was happy to see a sushi spot near my place because I am wont to crave sushi. I stopped by on my way back from TJ lugging like 30lb of groceries. I was pleasantly surprised to see that the miso soup was $2 and that price of this staple, at least, was not inflated in San Francisco. I placed my takeout order and got the veggie gyoza, a crunchy spicy tuna w/ no avocado, a volcano roll, and a miso soup - I was ordering while hungry! I thought the food took longer to arrive than I expected but I figured it was probably because the gyoza actually has to be cooked but there were also quite a few people dining in. In any case, I was happy to be able to put my stuff down when the server told me I could have a seat at the bar to wait.

Once I got home, I was ready to dig in but I wanted to put all my stuff away and settle in so I didn't end up eating it til 20 minutes or so later. Once I finally did get to the food, I was (hilariously) taken aback by how small the miso soup portion was - it was like a 2 or 3oz container as opposed to the 6oz containers I'm used to on the east coast. San Francisco prices win again! The gyoza was alright - I enjoyed that there was bit of crunch to the dough but the filling itself wasn't particularly flavorful and the accompanying sauce was soooo salty. It's like they just added scallions and salt to soy sauce. The crunchy spicy tuna roll was pretty good and the volcano roll had potential but the spicy tuna topping was rather bland.

While this place was not outstanding I would give it another chance with different rolls and I'd also try dining in.
author: Leslie C.

description: Best secret in the area. The fish is so amazing. The roll pairings are really fresh. I have not had a bad menu item yet...
author: Norman S.

description: Decent lunch time bento box specials for approx $13.  Pick of an appetizer size portion (I chose hamachi sashimi), an entree portion (salmon teriyaki) and a sushi (shiitake mushroom making sushi).  The meal came with miso soup, salad with ginger dressing and white rice.  I exchanged out the rice for an extra serving of salad.  Service was polite and efficient.   Fish was fresh and the hot tea was served continuously.  The staff did not rush us out when though they had a bustling lunch crowd.
author: Hiromi N.

description: I remember bookmarking this place and wanting to try because it looked great!  However, I was not totally impressed.  It's a very small place and we got seated pretty fast but I didn't care too much for the tonkatsu that I ordered and the b&w roll that my friend and I ordered.  I just didn't care for the sushi and the overall food that I ordered.  Our waiter was friendly and always came by to fill our waters.  Other than that, it was okay experience for me.
author: Mikayla M.

description: Fast and kind service and delicious rolls. Very hole in the wall vibe but worth stopping by. Sweet potato fries and dipping sauce unexpectedly delicious as well.
author: Claire L.

description:
Should have passed over this place when I saw that there was no AC on this hot Labor Day weekend.  The doors were open and there was only a fan to try to keep patrons from sweating.  Got fooled by the other Yelp reviews and the pictures.

Ordered edamame, fried dumplings, spicy tuna roll, and salmon skin roll.

My critique of the food:

Problem #1 - the edamame was not completely or evenly cooked.  Parts of the edamame were cold while other parts in the serving bowl was warm.  Never experienced this before in any sushi restaurant.

Problem #2 - The fried dumplings had edamame mixed in with the inside ingredients.  I guess this is a fusion thing.  Did not like this.

Problem #3 - The sushi rice was too soggy and I couldn't tell if there was any sushi vinegar in the rice.  

Problem #4 - The spicy mayo sauce that was used to make spicy tuna  was not seasoned right.  And the tuna pieces were too chunky.

Problem #5 - The Salmon skin in the roll was over fried to an ultra dried crisp and mixed with Bonito type flakes.

When my wife expressed her dissatisfaction to the waiter, he had nothing to say.  We paid our bill and left.  

As we walked out, we noticed that there was a tall bowl of water with ice in front of the fan.  Their attempt to provide cooler air i.e. a poor man's attempt at AC.

Not sure why this sushi place got good reviews, but I would have rather bought premade sushi at Ralphs or Whole Foods.
author: Charles L.

description:
I wish I didn't adventure into this place I went in with an empty stomach and within 20 minutes of the meal started having a stomach ache so I knew it was the food. The chirashi don was by an assortment of sashimi chosen by the the chef and several pieces of the hamachi was very fishy. I later discovered on my own that they put Escolar or butterfish in it and that could have been the culprit as Escolar is a cheap fish known to upset stomachs. The double shrimp roll was raw shrimp with two pieces of tempura front and back and also not good. 

The prices for the quality of food is not good. I left half the food uneaten, paid, and left.
author: N A.

description: Sat down took me almost 20 Mins to even get asked if I wanted a drink. Then it took me 30 Mins after that to even see if my food was ready, which it wasn't. A white woman sits next to me at the bar and She gets a drink within 5 minutes and they took her order quickly. I couldn't even sit there after that, I left. I would like to be treated the same way because my money is the same color.
author: Sean V.

description: The best sushi place in San Francisco. If you are looking for authentic taste and great hospitality this is the place you want to go. The sushi will disappear in front of your eyes, it's delicious. If you are a tourist looking for a great place to eat for a good price you need to come here, it's right next to hotel Zetta. Check this place out if you like spending your money on real food.
author: Nero D.

description: Loved this place! Service was great! Prices are good. We had spicy tuna roll and caterpillar roll , both were tasty .
author: Paige M.

description: You have to eat at this place really I never yelp but if there's a line wait thank you guys for a great night
author: Jesse H.

description: It's fine as far as sushi goes, but nothing special.  The service was friendly, but not very organized.   Overall, just a meh experience.   We each ordered 3 items - 6 total  They came out one at a time.  Mine, mine, mine, his, his, his.  And all on separate plates, so there was no room for any of it if on the table.  Made for an awkward meal.
author: Kristy A.

description: The customer service is terrible and very disorganized. We got the spicy crunchy salmon roll which is neither spicy nor crunchy. Maybe other things on the menu are better
author: Shannon W.

description: We stopped at this sushi place for sushi. We ordered and when the sushi came out we were so happy. The sauces were in cool designs and the sushi was so delicious! The   Staff were so friendly and kind. The iced green tea was so flavor full. This restaurant was so nice and cool too.
author: David D.

description: I ordered a Rainbow Roll which was missing half of the fish and other half looked unappetizing, but the staff was nice about taking it back. The appetizers are good, but I am personally not a fan of their sushi after this experience.
author: Ashley G.

description: This sushi bar stands out from the rest! Amazing service, amazing food, and amazing vibes! A must go to if you are in the area and fiending for sushi
author: Adam J.

description: Awesome! Delicious sushi! Great service, super nice people! Good price! My favorite place for sushi. I've order trough the app Eat24 and also had lunch in the restaurant and both times were excellent.
author: Natalia T.

description: Love this place. Friendly staff, well-priced, and quality sushi. I come here at least once a week.
author: Colton R.

description:
Had I been a broke college student visiting from Desolateville maybe I would have enjoyed my thick cut (possibly previously frozen) chef's choice sashimi and sweet af sauvignon blanc. Patrons taking sake bombs at the bar might have even been super eentertaining to watch, unfortunately/fortunately however I've experienced quality wine and fresh fish having worked in the food & beverage industry and as a 10 year SF resident. What have I become??a food snob.

Prices and plates are very attractive. Service is fast and attentive..almost speedy Gonzalez-like. Hopefully ambience and food quality is low on your priority list. But if a late night, non-zen sushi spot after a day of shopping is your desire, you've found it! They plan on staying open till midnight.

I imagine their Berkeley location is a huge success :)
author: eVa J.

description:
This place was well reviewed, which got us through the door.  Then we ordered...

1) The presentation was beautiful.
2) The fish was legit.
3) The service was great, and Audy, one of the owners came out to greet us, bought us a round a Sake, and let us know he was happy to have us.

Happy hour has some great options, and portions were just right. 

We were all very impressed with this Kaisen Sushi. Great spot to visit in you are in the city. 

*The music was on point too, lots of fun!
author: Jeff y.

description:
Great food and service! One of the few sushi restaurants open for late lunch in San Francisco. Decent prices and high quality sushi. I had the caterpillar roll and avocado tuna roll. 

The only downfall- I asked to wash my hands and a restroom wasn't available in the restaurant. The waitress gave me a towelette.
author: Rochelle L.

description: This place has solid service and really good food. In addition, the environment is clean and the atmosphere upbeat and modern. The food is fresh the price is reasonable and the service is prompt. You will be happy and satisfied eating at this establishment.
author: Jessica P.

description:
Stumbled across this tiny spot while walking around Union Square. Sushi is good! Large portions with beautiful sauce design (definitely Instagram worthy). Service is awesome. They even encouraged our sake bombing and comped us extra sake.

Overall a great spot - would recommend
author: Aubrey F.

description:
The service here is really good. The wait staff is friendly, responsive, and patient. The quality of the fish is okay, not the best. But okay for the price. The rice and actual rolls are pretty bad though. The spider roll I ordered fell apart and came with a giant sauce octopus on the okay that made for cute presentation and awful flavor. The nigiri was good - I got salmon and tamago.

If the service wasn't solid I would have given this 2 stars. If I come back here I'm only going to get the Nigiri.
author: Vaibhav M.

description: This place was delicious. Excellent selection of sake, plus great happy hour. Everyone was really friendly and service was really quick. Sushi was reasonably priced and completely perfect. Plus...the presentation was an absolute A+. I uploaded some art because I loved it so much. We will be back!
author: Yo M.

description: My boyfriend, brother, and I were looking for a place to eat and we chose this place because we had just left Nordstrom shopping, SO happy we did. They gave my brother free edamame because we mentioned he was starving. Then when they brought out his roll they had made a Christmas tree out of the dressing for the roll. This was literally the highlight of my visit to San Fran. The owner was the sweetest and everyone we encountered that worked there was truly nice. Also, the spicy salmon hand roll was AWESOME!! And the pitcher of Sapporo was cheap. Definitely an awesome hangout sushi bar. Will definitely be coming back during our next visit to San Fran
author: Brianna O.

description:
New restaurant right next to Westfield mall in SF. Probably the best sushi I've had in awhile for a very affordable price.  Really really fresh fish , I got the sashimi deluxe (14 pieces for $23) and the cherry blossom.  

Ari, the owner, is super accommodating and makes you feel taken care of. Definitely coming here again and again with my friends.  I expect lines are going to get long once people figure this gem out. 

5 stars for service and food
author: Kevin P.

description: This is the best Sushi restaurant in downtown of San Francisco . I ordered  baked scallop roll and rock&roll BBQ. They decorated the fancy dish. Look beautiful!! The taste is very good and fresh. Nice service and friendly staffs. I will come back here again
author: Alice W.

description:
The sushi place that used to be here (like a month ago) scared me. It was always empty, whenever id walk by which was a lot so the turn over of fish was a little worrisome. 

In comes Kaisen! I love everything about this new sushi place and I hope the reputation of Sushi Club doesn't keep people from coming in. Great service, great prices and unique presentation!
author: Liz F.

description: I stopped by with my boyfriend on our way out of San Fransisco and I was not the least bit disappointed! The servers were quick and attentive. The ambiance was nice, a little crowded but that didn't take away from the experience. We ordered the Toshi roll (not pictured), the Beach Crunch roll, and the Black Sea roll. All were so fresh and delicious! Also the prices were fair for the portions. Next time I visit SF I will definitely stop by!
author: Natalie R.

description: Pretty awesome. Food is good and atmosphere is chill. Price was reasonable. The poke salad is lame. Everything else was excellent. Recommended
author: Thien T.

description: So good! The live uni was amazing and so was the Dragon Roll, which had incredible sauce art. I highly recommend Kaisen.
author: Joshua M.

description: The Spicy Salmon Crunchy Roll  and it was SOLID! I'm as bit of a sushi enthusiast and I will definitely be coming back. Great sushi, great presentation, fair price.
author: Caleb B.

description: Excellent food, great service! Hope they're around for a very long time.  I had there bento box with chicken teriyaki which was absolutely moist and tender. And their seaweed salad was the best I've ever had
author: Marianne A.

description: The bento box was great and very filling for $13.99. The miso soup was served right away and the lunch came shortly after. My only complaint was the lack of flexility in substituting your options, you will get charged $3 dollars for any slight deviation.
author: Nicole S.

description: I got the bento box.. the complementary miso tasted standard, but was bigger than norm!   From the bento:  Takoyaki was fine, salmon w/out teriyaki was decent, salad was standard, which is normally a lil too much dressing for me. The negihama roll was not fresh.. very fishy for a mild fish. Should have stuck to the cooked stuff.
author: J T.

description: Went and got the sashimi combo special. Ended up being pretty good. Not the best but was good. Came with miso soup and a salad. Service was fine.
author: Olivia L.

description: Can you say HIGH BLOOD PRESSURE! I grabbed some to go for lunch and literally feel the sodium taking over my body. Flavor doesn't mean sodium...I'm afraid to even give the food away because I don't want to make anyone sick or to have a stroke or heartache, if they have high blood pressure or not supposed to have sodium in their diet.
author: Nhp C.

description: Great spot and really close to market. Sitting at the bar and a group next to me got a killer looking dragon drawn in sauce!
author: Matt M.

description: Just ate a good and plentiful  meal at one of San Francisco's many sushi restaurants. I would have rated it higher but the miso soup was luke warm, the server didnt provide me with a spoon and i didn't have a napkin. She finally got it right...hot miso soup!
author: Pam M.

description: One of the best sushi I've had in SF. I absolutely loved their Tuna Tataki. The staff is very friendly. I highly recommend this place to all authentic sushi lovers!!
author: Joe B.

description: Lackluster. With so many sushi restaurants in the area, you would think it would be better to be more competitive. Flavors were bland and a little off for your traditional items. Needless to say, I won't be back.
author: Jeanette C.

description: Friendly service, they almost came over to check on me too much. The fish is.. okay, a little rubbery. Did not really like the ambience, but I guess it seems more like a watch-tv-and-chill-with-sushi place then a nice-restaurant-experience place (which is more of what I'm into).
author: Jakob Eats Alone ..

description: Great little sushi bar in San Fran.  The service was excellent and the sushi was good quality.
author: Nancy W.

description: Good quick Sushi eats in Union Square area of SF, good service, small venue , but good food with pretty flare.
author: Dulcie C.

description: Just had sushi from here for the first time with my girlfriend, and we would highly recommend! Prices are very fair for its central location, and they were very generous with the meat. Tasted amazing! We ordered ahead and picked up our order to go. The staff was extremely friendly and physically went through every item in our order to confirm that it was correct before we took it. Will definitely be going here again!
author: Ian S.

description: Nice staff, take out is prepared quickly, and it's conveniently located with the entrance on 5th st. It's fine for a quick bite but the quality of the sushi is not as high as I prefer. I like the preparation of the salmon aburri.
author: Marina N.

description: What an amazing place! I accidentally stumbled onto this place, and I gotta say, this isn't your Kusakabe, but for the price, it's pretty damn good. The staff here are extremely friendly, and though their fish isn't A++ quality, it's still very fresh & worth what you're paying for. Make sure you ask for Audy! He's the manager, and he'll definitely take care of you. 10/10 would recommend!
author: Ashley K.

description: Great chicken teriyaki dish, but was slightly disappointed when I arrived a few minutes after my scheduled pick up time and my order was not sent to the kitchen yet.
author: Nick D.

description:
Arrived in San Fran late Saturday night around 9:30 ish first time in the city so didn't realize that unlike NYC most places close at 9 pm.
Luckily Kaiden was still open and right next to my hotel. The place had a decent crowd and club music being played over large speakers. The menu has your typical sushi roll offerings didn't see anything extra ordinary.
 Ordered spicy tuna , shrimp
Tempura Dan vegetable dumplings he service was good and sushi tasted fresh and yummy can't ask for more after a 250 mile drive So-Cal.
author: Imran Q.

description: Great sushi. Really nice people. Discounted drinks and food at happy hour. Can't wait to come back!
author: Wes F.

description: Wonderful people, great atmosphere, and nice high quality fish. A truly welcome addition to this part of town!
author: Rand F.

description: Overall tasty sushi - fresh and cool decorated plates with sauces. A little cozy and stuffy if full, but overall good value. I recommend
author: Keegan B.

description: Delicious and extremely friendly staff! Very generous to anyone working in the neighborhood. The bento box is a great deal for lunch or for dinner.
author: Stephen B.

description: Came here on a Saturday evening with my girlfriend. We were immediately seated at the bar. Although we were not given a choice of sitting at a table or the bar, we didn't mind. The wait staff and sushi chefs were very friendly and helpful. They would occasionally check on us to see if we enjoyed our food. We ordered a Cherry Blossom roll and a Salmon Lover's roll. Both came out quickly, and were decorated with various sauces arranged into a mini art piece. The sushi chefs told us that the sauce art was edible, and the waiter explained to us what each sauce was. The sauces included unagi sauce, spicy mayo, and wasabi mayo(?). We ate the sushi with and without the sauce, and it was delicious! Definitely would come back again!
author: Brandon N.

description: I went here last Saturday night around 8pm - when these guys didn't even have a yelp page! Figured they must be new. Friendly servers/staff. The sushi was well priced (not cheap, not too expensive) and really yummy. We got 4 or 5 different rolls and nobody had any complaints. :) will definitely be back.
author: McKenzie D.

description: Very good sushi. It's beautifully served. Good price and very nice stuff. 7 tables and about 10 seats near the bar make it great place for romantic dinner but not for hanging with large group of friends. I can strongly recommend it for lunch and dinner. It's not far from any place because it's near Market St so in the heart of San Francisco.
author: Kamil B.

description: Quick clean and easy. Friendly staff, great daily specials. And the salmon lover roll is banging
author: Joybella M.

description: The place is small. We sat at the bar and I ordered the chef sashimi special. Some fish was fresher than others, and coming from Hawaii, I'm used to right out of the ocean kind of fresh. Overall it was good! The service, being that its small and very busy was very slow. Otherwise, great place!
author: Samantha K.

description: Stopped by here for a last minute dinner with friends on a recent trip to San Fran. Had really been looking forward to the beautifully decorated plates with the special rolls. Ordered the crunchy spicy tuna roll and it was just a bog standard order; nothing special about it at all. So disappointing!
author: Melly M.

description: The sushi and sashimi combo was very good as were the rolls we had. The miso soup had good flavor and the salad tasted fresh. Those are the good points, now for the bad. The service was terrible to say the least. There were only 4 people in there but we must have been invisible. We are not Asian so the waitress did not seem interested in us. We had to ask for our soup and salad and they eventually came but not until we had our main course. I will not return, even with the free shot of saki.
author: Tracy G.

description: We chose to eat here to see the artworks with our own eyes and we were not disappointed.  We ordered the cherry blossom roll, the b&w roll, the baked scallop roll, the rainbow roll, and tonkatsu.  Out of all those ordered, my favorite was the baked scallop roll.  Although it took 15 minutes to arrive, it was worth the wait.  It came piping hot and wrapped with aluminum foil.  The roll is topped with baked cheesy mayonnaise with a thick layer of scallop underneath.  Do give this roll a try.  One thing to note is that escolar is on the menu.  Upon a quick search, escolar is also known as "ex-lax fish", any amount more than 6oz will cause explosive gastrointestinal issues.  Therefore, eat with caution.  All-in-all, this Vietnamese-operated establishment provides good quality food.  Service was also good albeit few minor mistakes that were amended quickly.
author: J H.

description: After dinner, I will say I upped my review.  The service was pretty good.  But I still don't understand how you have avocado for certain rolls, but not avocado rolls.
author: Jack G.

description: Definitely not worth eating. Flavorless, and the tuna was a funny color.
author: David T.

description: How does this place have 4.5 stars on yelp? This is a 1-2 star place for sure. The people who are saying this is the best sushi in the neighborhood or the city maybe have only eaten Safeway supermarket sushi...in Oklahoma? Or really love colored mayonnaise art to dip their sushi into? I lived in Japan for a few years, so I maybe have higher standards than others, but this is basically a Union Square spot for tourists or daytrippers/shoppers from the suburbs. The prices are not cheap at all and the fish is of the quality that you start getting a little disturbed on the second and third bites. Disturbed like, why is this fish so soft and falling apart? how long have they had the fish? Is it even sashimi-grade fish? I ordered a chirashi-sushi (slices of sashimi on top of rice) for $23 dollars. It came with about 7-8 THIN slices of fish and FOUR of those were COOKED FISH. I have never seen cooked fish served for chirashi-sushi and certainly not nearly 1/2 the fish in the dish being cooked. That just screamed CHEAP to me and that they kept sashimi fish so long that they decided they had to cook it in order for it to be safe to serve. It was also clear to me from the way that the fish and the tsukemono (pickles) were sliced and the sushi roll rice was prepared that the sushi chefs had not trained for their jobs. The slicing and the presentation were random and haphazard. The sushi roll rice was over compacted and gummy (almost like the machine-rolled costco sushi rolls). What the chefs have been trained in is making elaborate dragons out of colored mayonnaise. So this is the kind of sushi place to go to if you are into colored mayonnaise art. The other thing that really bothered me was the seating and the overall ambiance. The seats were rock-hard stools with no backs, there was random tacky blue light emanating from under the bar, bright fluorescent lights from above, super loud music AND the fast and the furious playing, the walls were scuffed concrete painted in different shades of industrial putty/beige, the doors were wide open to entice tourists to come it. It just wasn't a pleasant restaurant experience, food aside. We deeply regretted not having gone to our regular spot in the same neighborhood, Sanraku, which is in the Metreon. That is a Japanese-run place with high standards, pleasant atmosphere, and I would say prices on par or cheaper than Kaisen. There's really no reason to eat at Kaisen unless you are a desperate tourist who does not have a smartphone.
author: Cat M.

description: A tiny little spot with long waits, poor service and ok food. I dont live in SF & perhaps my expectations are unreasonable, but it took us good 20-30 min to get servers attention, which is odd since the place is really small. I do however know what good sushi is, and this place was just ok. My kids ordered katsu, & it too was just ok. The meat was overcooked & dry.
author: Gary K.

description: I randomly stopped by for lunch. And it's more than I expected since it's a brand new sushi restaurant; the fish here is fresh and the staff is very friendly. Will come back again soon.
author: Jessica S.

description: The service was excellent and most of the food was good. I did however receive a few pieces of sushi with terrible cuts of tuna. I even found a small bone in one which is ridiculous. The presentation was beautiful but they really need to focus more on the fish.
author: Patrick M.

description: kaisen is a great place for a quick stop if you're craving Japanese food. The owner is awesome and extremely accommodating.
author: Chris W.

description: The fish wasn't particularly fresh, this service often times required flagging someone down, and getting a drink menu required asking for it.
author: zack h.

description: Ordered take out. sushi was fine but salmon teriyaki was inedible.  Covered in crushed whole black peppercorns.  Embedded in fish so we could not remove them... which means that was all you can taste.  And that after having to wait 40 mins for food after they told me on phone it would be 20 mins.  They don't offer refunds over the phone so check your food before you leave unless you want to go back.  We won't be.
author: Kevin O.

description: Excellent fresh sushi. Plating was cool with multicolor sauce designs around the food. What's not to be with Japanese beer by the pitcher. A great find.
author: Carl K.

description: The spicy salmon roll is excellent with the avocado and the little added crunch.  Plus, it is very reasonably priced.
author: Amy H.

description: Excellent sushi, great presentation. I would definitely recommend the Lion King Roll. They blew me away with this one. Lots of variety and fresh cuts.
author: Mickell L.
